Activity: A xylan binding function has been demonstrated in several cases and affinity with mixed β-1,3/β-1,4-glucans in one. In several cases a thermostabilizing effect has also been seen.
EC: Axylan binding function has been demonstrated in several cases and affinity with mixed β-1,3/β-1,4-glucans in one. In several cases a thermostabilizing effect has also been seen.

Activity: Modules of approx. 120 residues. The cellulose-binding function has been demonstrated in one case on amorphous cellulose and β-1,4-xylan. Some of these modules also bind β-1,3-glucan, β-1,3-1,4-glucan, and β-1,4-glucan.
EC: Modulesof approx. 120 residues. The cellulose-binding function has been demonstrated in one case on amorphous cellulose and β-1,4-xylan. Some of these modules also bind β-1,3-glucan, β-1,3-1,4-glucan, and β-1,4-glucan.

Activity: Modules of approx. 100 residues with glycogen-binding function, appended to GH13 modules. Also found in the beta subunit (glycogen-binding) of AMP-activated protein kinases (AMPK)
EC: Modulesof approx. 100 residues with glycogen-binding function, appended to GH13 modules. Also found in the beta subunit (glycogen-binding) of AMP-activated protein kinases (AMPK

Activity: Modules of approx. 130 residues. A module that is conserved in three Cellvibrio xylan-degrading enzymes binds to xylan and the interaction is calcium dependent, while a module from a Cellvibrio mannanase binds to decorated soluble mannans and mannooligosaccharides. A module in a	Phanerochaete chrysosporium galactan 1,3-β-galactosidase binds to β-galactan.
EC: Modulesof approx. 130 residues. A module that is conserved in three Cellvibrio xylan-degrading enzymes binds to xylan and the interaction is calcium dependent, while a module from a Cellvibrio mannanase binds to decorated soluble mannans and mannooligosaccharides. A module in a	Phanerochaete chrysosporium galactan 1,3-β-galactosidase binds to β-galactan.

Activity: Modules of approx. 150 residues found attached to various enzymes from  families GH2, GH27, GH31, GH95, GH98 and GH101 . Binding to galactose and to blood group A/B-antigens demonstrated in the  case of C. perfringens GH95CBM51 and GH98CBM51 respectively [Gregg KJ et al. (2008) J. Biol. Chem. 283:12604-13 PMID: 18292090].
EC: Modulesof approx. 150 residues found attached to various enzymes from  families GH2, GH27, GH31, GH95, GH98 and GH101 . Binding to galactose and to blood group A/B-antigens demonstrated in the  case of C. perfringens GH95CBM51 and GH98CBM51 respectively [Gregg KJ et al. (2008) J. Biol. Chem. 283:12604-13 PMID: 18292090].

Activity: Modules of approx. 180-200 residues. The CBM11 of Clotridium thermocellum Cel26A-Cel5E has been shown to bind both β-1,4-glucan and β-1,3-1,4-mixed linked glucans.
EC: Modulesof approx. 180-200 residues. The CBM11 of Clotridium thermocellum Cel26A-Cel5E has been shown to bind both β-1,4-glucan and β-1,3-1,4-mixed linked glucans.
